footer.tagline: Academic research platform for screen time monitoring and digital wellbeing studies
footer.getStartedDesc: Register as a parent to monitor your child's screen time, or as a researcher to access anonymized data for academic studies.
footer.parentGuide: Parents can create profiles for their children, set time limits, and track device usage.
footer.researcherGuide: Researchers can request access to anonymized data for academic studies with proper ethical approval.
footer.aboutUsDesc: Screen Guardian is an academic research project designed to help families manage screen time while contributing to research on digital wellbeing.

about.title: About Screen Guardian
about.subtitle: An academic research platform bridging digital wellbeing and family health research
about.missionDesc: Screen Guardian aims to empower families with tools to manage children's screen time while contributing to vital research on digital wellbeing and child development in the digital age.
about.researchDesc: We facilitate academic research on screen time patterns, digital behavior, and the impact of technology on child development, while maintaining the highest ethical and privacy standards.
about.parentsDesc: Parents gain insights into their children's screen time habits, set healthy boundaries, and track device usage across multiple platforms.
about.researchersDesc: Researchers access anonymized, ethically-sourced data to study digital behavior patterns, screen time impacts, and develop evidence-based recommendations.
about.institutionsDesc: Universities and research institutions partner with us to conduct ethical studies on digital wellbeing and child development.
about.ethicsDesc: All research conducted through Screen Guardian follows strict ethical guidelines, requires informed consent, and undergoes institutional review board (IRB) approval. Data privacy and participant safety are our top priorities.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.subtitle: How we protect your data and ensure ethical research practices
privacy.dataPoint3: Children's profiles (names and age groups - pseudonymized for research)
privacy.protection1: All data encrypted in transit (TLS/SSL) and at rest (AES-256)
privacy.protection2: Role-based access control - users only access their authorized data
privacy.protection3: Regular security audits and penetration testing
privacy.researchUseDesc: Data may be used for academic research under strict conditions:
privacy.anonymizationDesc: All personal identifiers are removed before data is shared with researchers. Children are assigned anonymous IDs, and no names or contact information are included in research datasets.
privacy.research1: Researchers must have IRB approval from their institution
privacy.research2: Parents must grant explicit consent for their data to be included
privacy.research3: Data is aggregated and anonymized - individual families cannot be identified
privacy.yourRightsDesc: Under GDPR and academic research ethics, you have the right to:
privacy.right1: Access your personal data and see what information we hold
privacy.right3: Delete your account and all associated data
privacy.right4: Withdraw consent for research participation at any time
privacy.right5: Export your data in a portable format
privacy.consentDesc: Participation in research is entirely voluntary:
privacy.consent1: You can use Screen Guardian without participating in research
privacy.consent2: Consent can be granted or withdrawn at any time
privacy.consent3: Withdrawing consent does not affect your ability to use the platform
privacy.contactDesc: For questions about privacy or to exercise your rights, contact our Data Protection Officer:
